intro: Urachne comosa, commonly known as the hairy urachne, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a slender, upright stem covered in fine, hairy hairs, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in a cluster at the top of the stem. Urachne comosa is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
